page.title: 11The Army at Middle Wallop.
page.content: Middle Wallop camp and airfield the Army Air Corps Centre was originally built in 1939 as a Royal Air Force station, and was a major fighter station throughout the 1939-1945 war. It became a Naval air station for one year but otherwise remained Royal Air Force until 1957, when the unit that trained Army pilots expanded and took over the whole station. Since 1958 the station has been entirely Army and, as the camp has no barracks name, the title Army Air Corps Centre serves for both. For the period 1965 - 1973 the Centre was entitled the Army Aviation Centre and the training wings were grouped into the School of Army Aviation, but the present organisation dates from 1974.
